Articles.Content:
I have a bug report that I'd like to have closed, but its months old and there is no chance it'll be found on it's own.  Some of the Managers names listed on the bugtracker are recognizable as developers, but I don't want to bother them, I'm sure they have something better to do.  I'd spoken to Squelch before about some bugtracker questions, but he no longer appears to be the QA Manager or work for Squad anymore so I'm out of contacts for this QA environment.

Chris.Fulton is listed as a Manager on the bugtracker, and is currently active (as in within the past 24 hours) in setting bugs as Ready to Test, and also Closed.  Problem is, there doesn't seem to be a way within the bugtracker to contact him; maybe I'm missing the message feature?  I did a member search here, to no avail.   I suppose Joshua.Collins or Anthony.Price would work as well as I would imagine they'd have the same permissions.

Do you happen to have the bug report number?

Edited April 12, 2019 by Just Jim

https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/18778

 

As you can see it was changed to "Investigating", left that way, and then fixed without a change to Ready to Test or even a mention in patch notes about it being fixed.

It's this kind of thing that makes participating on the bugtracker a super frustrating affair.

OK, it's closed.  Thanks for the heads up

Edited April 13, 2019 by Just Jim

Thanks.  I appreciate it.

So there is no way to contact the QA manager like I was able to do with Squelch?  I had some questions about bug reporting preferences or best practices prior, and it was nice having that ability to reach out and get some answers that weren't on the wiki.  I did so via pm here n the forums, because Squelch had a presence on the forums here, and I believe his forum title was "QA Lead" or somesuch.

 

Thanks again.

I'm one of the QA Leads... at least that's what it says in the game credits... lol... 

I'm very limited as far as what I can say or do on here, obviously, but I'd be glad to help if I can.

Edited April 13, 2019 by Just Jim

On 4/12/2019 at 8:23 PM, Just Jim said:

I'm one of the QA Leads...

 

Can you get Chris Fulton to clarify this? 

https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/21278

Quote


Quote

Changes have been made in 1.7 for part revamps, moving to RTT and please check if this is fixed.

 

I'm not sure what you mean by this? I don't see any settings for mipmap bias or trilinear filtering in 1.7, does that mean they were hardcoded?
